publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2702 Margaret Mitchell:Bank of Scotland Midnightleague—That the Parliament congratulates the Bank of Scotland on its renewed sponsorship of the Midnightleague football programme which was so successful last year; commends this initiative which provides constructive activity for youngsters on Friday and Saturday evenings until late; applauds the increase in the number of leagues from 14 to 17 and the aim to involve a total of 3,000 young people between the ages of 12 and 16, 1,200 more than last year; welcomes the commitment by the Scottish Football Association, the police and local authorities, and recognises and applauds the potential contribution that the Midnightleague can make to combating youth crime and obesity among young people.

S2M-2702 Margaret Mitchell: Bank of Scotland Midnightleague—That the Parliament congratulates the Bank of Scotland on its renewed sponsorship of the Midnightleague football programme which was so successful last year; commends this initiative which provides constructive activity for youngsters on Friday and Saturday evenings until late; applauds the increase in the number of leagues from 14 to 17 and the aim to involve a total of 3,000 young people between the ages of 12 and 16, 1,200 more than last year; welcomes the commitment by the Scottish Football Association, the police and local authorities, and recognises and applauds the potential contribution that the Midnightleague can make to combating youth crime and obesity among young people. Supported by: Margaret Jamieson*, Alex Johnstone*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Michael McMahon*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Murdo Fraser*, Alex Fergusson*, Linda Fabiani*, Mr David Davidson*, Dr Jean Turner*, Stewart Stevenson* R, Murray Tosh*, Mike Pringle*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-2702 Bank of Scotland Midnightleague (lodged on 14 April 2005) Bill Aitken*, Robert Brown*, Phil Gallie*, Alex Neil*, Mary Scanlon*
S2M-2702 Bank of Scotland Midnightleague (lodged on 14 April 2005) Sarah Boyack*, John Scott*, Tricia Marwick*
